March 12, 1959
Mr. Horace B. Powell
Publications Director
W. K. Kellogg Foundation
250 Champion Street
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Mr. Powelli
Since you and I worked together last spring. Dr. Skornia has asked me to
reply to your letter of March 5*
We are extremely pleased that the NAEB will be featured in the Education
Division’s chapter of the 1959 Annual Report of the W. K. Kellogg Foundation,
and we will do everything possible to cooperate with you on this matter.
As you will recall from our conversations last year, the support of the
Foundation has been vital to the operation of the NAEB Headquarters for the
past eight years, and has made possible a tremendous growth and development
in the field of educational broadcasting. Likewise, Foundation support made
possible the establishment of the NAEB Radio Network, which is now self-
supporting. So far as specific projects supported by Foundation funds are
concerned, about all the information I can give you in addition to that given
you last spring is that we are continuing with our work and are still growing.
There is one major development made possible by Foundation funds which I be¬
lieve we discussed last spring. In December, 1957 the NAEB held the first
national seminar devoted to an examination of research in the field of edu¬
cational broadcasting, underwritten substantially by Foundation funds. The
report of this seminar has Just recently been completed and I am enclosing
a copy of it for your perusal. I believe you will find some information
therein that will be worth reporting in your Annual Report. The seminar
was well received and the report of it was reprinted almost in its entirety
ir the latest issue of Audio-Visual Communications Review.
I am also enclosing a copy of our annual report for 1957-58 to the Foundation
for your information. This report covers the highlights of the preceeding
year and devotes considerable space to a discussion of the Research Seminar.
